001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandGroupBase.requireUngrouped;
009
010import java.util.Map;
011import java.util.function.Supplier;
012
013/**
014 * Runs one of a selection of commands, either using a selector and a key to command mapping, or a
015 * supplier that returns the command directly at runtime. Does not actually schedule the selected
016 * command - rather, the command is run through this command; this ensures that the command will
017 * behave as expected if used as part of a CommandGroup. Requires the requirements of all included
018 * commands, again to ensure proper functioning when used in a CommandGroup. If this is undesired,
019 * consider using {@link ScheduleCommand}.
020 *
021 * <p>As this command contains multiple component commands within it, it is technically a command
022 * group; the command instances that are passed to it cannot be added to any other groups, or
023 * scheduled individually.
024 *
025 * <p>As a rule, CommandGroups require the union of the requirements of their component commands.
026 *
027 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
028 */
029public class SelectCommand extends CommandBase {
030  private final Map<Object, Command> m_commands;
031  private final Supplier<Object> m_selector;
032  private final Supplier<Command> m_toRun;
033  private Command m_selectedCommand;
034  private boolean m_runsWhenDisabled = true;
035  private InterruptionBehavior m_interruptBehavior = InterruptionBehavior.kCancelIncoming;
036
037  /**
038   * Creates a new selectcommand.
039   *
040   * @param commands the map of commands to choose from
041   * @param selector the selector to determine which command to run
042   */
043  public SelectCommand(Map<Object, Command> commands, Supplier<Object> selector) {
044    requireUngrouped(commands.values());
045
046    CommandGroupBase.registerGroupedCommands(commands.values().toArray(new Command[] {}));
047
048    m_commands = requireNonNullParam(commands, "commands", "SelectCommand");
049    m_selector = requireNonNullParam(selector, "selector", "SelectCommand");
050
051    m_toRun = null;
052
053    for (Command command : m_commands.values()) {
054      m_requirements.addAll(command.getRequirements());
055      m_runsWhenDisabled &= command.runsWhenDisabled();
056      if (command.getInterruptionBehavior() == InterruptionBehavior.kCancelSelf) {
057        m_interruptBehavior = InterruptionBehavior.kCancelSelf;
058      }
059    }
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Creates a new selectcommand.
064   *
065   * @param toRun a supplier providing the command to run
066   * @deprecated Replace with {@link ProxyCommand}
067   */
068  @Deprecated
069  public SelectCommand(Supplier<Command> toRun) {
070    m_commands = null;
071    m_selector = null;
072    m_toRun = requireNonNullParam(toRun, "toRun", "SelectCommand");
073
074    // we have no way of checking the underlying command, so default.
075    m_runsWhenDisabled = false;
076    m_interruptBehavior = InterruptionBehavior.kCancelSelf;
077  }
078
079  @Override
080  public void initialize() {
081    if (m_selector != null) {
082      if (!m_commands.keySet().contains(m_selector.get())) {
083        m_selectedCommand =
084            new PrintCommand(
085                "SelectCommand selector value does not correspond to" + " any command!");
086        return;
087      }
088      m_selectedCommand = m_commands.get(m_selector.get());
089    } else {
090      m_selectedCommand = m_toRun.get();
091    }
092    m_selectedCommand.initialize();
093  }
094
095  @Override
096  public void execute() {
097    m_selectedCommand.execute();
098  }
099
100  @Override
101  public void end(boolean interrupted) {
102    m_selectedCommand.end(interrupted);
103  }
104
105  @Override
106  public boolean isFinished() {
107    return m_selectedCommand.isFinished();
108  }
109
110  @Override
111  public boolean runsWhenDisabled() {
112    return m_runsWhenDisabled;
113  }
114
115  @Override
116  public InterruptionBehavior getInterruptionBehavior() {
117    return m_interruptBehavior;
118  }
119}
